title: Ukrainian ship carrying grain sails from Odessa, testing Russian threat
description: After Russia ended a U.N.-sponsored deal to allow safe passage for cargo ships carrying Ukrainian grain, the Kremlin warned that all boats in the Black Sea could be targets.

title: Drunk American tourists spent a night in the Eiffel Tower, prosecutors say
description: The two men "appeared to have got stuck because of how drunk they were" and fell asleep in a no-access area of the Eiffel Tower, prosecutors told French media.

title: U.S. military photos show how England changed during World World II
description: Aerial photos shot from U.S. warplanes during World War II, newly released by Historic England, feature a damaged Manchester soccer stadium and a racecourse storing military equipment.

title: This is the gayest World Cup ever (and no one’s batting an eyelid)
description: There are about 100 openly LGBTQ+ players and coaches in the women's World Cup. That kind of representation can be a catalyst for change, advocates say.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Poland holds large military parade in show of strength; Odessa grain buildings hit
description: President Andrzej Duda warned that Poland "will not be provoked" as he spoke of the Russia-Ukraine war and border defense.

title: Water scarcity in Iraq leads to the disappearance of a signature rice
description: As climate change tightens its grip on Iraq, amber rice is the latest casualty. Farmers are grappling not only with a loss of income, but a way of life.

title: North Korea’s Kim, in letter to Putin, vows solidarity with Russia
description: The United States has accused North Korea of supplying weapons to Russia to help in its war against Ukraine. While they deny this, there's no doubting their bond.

title: Paghahanap kay Maura
description: Mula Pilipinas, nagtungo si Maura sa 1904 World’s Fair para maitampok. Nang pumanaw siya, maaaring kinuha ng antropologo ng Smithsonian ang bahagi ng kaniyang utak.

title: How The Post reported Maura’s story
description: The Washington Post reported Maura’s history and the legacy of Ales Hrdlicka’s Smithsonian brains collection using archival photography and newspaper clippings.

title: Searching for Maura
description: Maura, a Filipino woman, died after coming to the U.S. to be put on display at the 1904 World's Fair. A Smithsonian anthropologist likely took part of her brain.

title: In Argentina, a new Trump rises
description: On Sunday, Javier Milei won the most votes in Argentina's primary election. His critics see, in his extreme rhetoric and views, a deadly threat to democracy.
